website_summaries.verdict: Everything a DIYer needs from a circular saw. Unbeatable price.
pros: Dust blower and laser line guide enhance accuracy
cons: Falls just short of pro demands

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 4 weeks, NO HELP from SKIL!!!
customer_reviews.text: The handle to control the depth broke off within 4 weeks. I am not “the rock” I pressed this down with normal pressure. Skil, after a 20m phone call with all kinds of questions, photos etc refuses to send me this $0.68 part saying it’s not a defect. Apparently normal use by a 5’ 8” 150# dude is too much stress for this toy of a tool. Will never buy Skil again.
customer_reviews.author: OceanicOpps

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: .. I used it to build this deck ADDED A NEW BLADE..VERY SMOOTH CUTS
customer_reviews.author: bolt fan

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to replace my harbor freight saw and so far I am very happy I did. I am using a Freud Diablo blade and so far it has cut perfectly straight and smooth cuts. I have made many cuts on melamine sheets over the weekend and didn't have any issues doing so. I cannot comment to the laser because I don't use it since I have mounted this saw onto a Kreg Rip Cut Jig and the combo of the rip jig and saw is a perfect combo. All I have to do now is set the rip jig to the correct length, make the cut and done. You can find the jig here
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: ... a circular saw and this thing cuts through wood like butter. I was cutting through 4x4 pressure treated ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using a circular saw and this thing cuts through wood like butter. I was cutting through 4x4 pressure treated lumber by cutting it on one side, flipping it over and then cutting the other side (You can't really do the depth to get through a 4x4). I then cut through a bunch of 2x4s in no time. The guides make it easy to use, and this thing is easy to make straight lines with. I haven't tried angle cuts, but it seemed pretty easy to adjust for that. The only trouble I had was finding the key tool. It is a black flat metal piece that slides into the back of the guide plate :)
customer_reviews.author: Ice cream samarai salami

customer_reviews.title: Blade stops while cutting
customer_reviews.text: While cutting any size board the blade will stop. According to the manual you have to remove the nut that holds the blade on and loosen it so it will operate, this seems to be a pain to work with while cutting. I never had this problem with my old Black and Decker which I had for 35 years. I bought the Skil because of the reviews and now I am disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this product’
customer_reviews.text: Blade jams easily. Asked a carpenter friend to look at it and it jammed on him. Would not recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: barbara NELSON

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a corded saw to supplement my cordless Dewalt, but this one felt awkward to me. I couldn't see the blade well and realized I'm used to, and prefer, the Dewalt style where the motor is on the outside; so when holding the handle with my right hand, I can clearly see the blade on my side. When I hold the Skil saw with my right hand, the motor is on the inside, closest to my body and I can't see the blade as easily. It does have the light for a guide, but I prefer to see the blade position exactly on my own penciled line. Otherwise, it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: glenk

customer_reviews.title: I Returned it.  I Believe it's Very Unsafe and Dangerous to Use.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak of how it runs. I returned it without trying it. I returned it for safety reasons. The blade guard is your only protection if something were to happen to the blade (blades do break!!). The blade guard on this saw is light weight plastic. If something happens with the steel blade, spinning at over 5000 RPM, the only thing protecting the user's life or limbs... or anyone else around while the saw is running is the saw's blade guard (it's called a guard for a reason), and this guard is light weight plastic. This 'guard' appears to be more of a cosmetic item then a functional protective item. I'm getting a saw with a strong Metal guard.
customer_reviews.author: Lee G

customer_reviews.title: Good Saw, Right Price
customer_reviews.text: I did my due diligence on circular saws before I decided to purchase this one. I like it overall, however, I do have to say that it seems as though the laser is hard to see and it also seems like it is a bit inaccurate - or maybe I just need to adjust... Either way, at the end of the day the saw gets the job done. Even better, it came with a blade so I didn't have to go out and purchase one separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: My last skilsaw purchased about 40 years ago finally died. This was its replacement, it is fine. I don't like that the blade guard protector handle is plastic, which means it may eventually brake/shear off if I am not careful during heavy use- the 40 year old one was all metal. I do like the laser guide, a nice touch. The safety button on this model is temperamental and somewhat difficult to engage at times- which means it is sort of anti-safety since I've had to use to hands at times to press the safety when starting the saw trigger at times. Lightweight and good power.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great saw - stupid safety switch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to replace a 30 year old Black & Decker saw that still worked but was much less powerful. I like the saw very much but anyone who is considering buying it needs to know that for some reason it has a "safety switch" placed so that you have to use 2 hands to start the saw blade movement - and, of course this allows the saw to "jump" away from your selected line. I will drill and pin this stupid and useless switch so that I can hold the saw steady - using both hands!
customer_reviews.author: John Lane, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Dead right after arrival
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked this and spent awhile mounting the blade according to instructions. Upon switching it on, the blade turned and then didn't turn. I switched it off and then switched it on again. This time smoke arose from the motor. It burned out upon first use. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a half hour total use.
customer_reviews.text: Used the saw about a half an hour total in , what I would think, normal cutting while building an outdoor play space for kids. Brushes started wearing out and the motor began skipping. So,,,a fairly costly saw was now inop. Went online to get brushes. No dice. Backordered and unavailable. Even if they WERE, there is no way that I should have to deal with this failing. Reached back into the shed and got a 30 year old B&D and finished the job. I bought this because it looked like it would be a good precision saw and it was very accurate and the laser worked well at assisting. Only wish longevity was a factor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK For the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I can only compare to my 40+ year old B&D 1-1/4hp 9amp circular saw which is dying. By comparison this saw is much lighter and significantly more powerful . I cross cut cherry 4/4 lumber all day and this saw cut like butter. I did not find the lock mechanism for the trigger that much of annoyance and the build given the all plastic body and blade guide is satisfactory (partly responsible for the weight reduction). Lever lock for the height adjustment works well. The metal base is comparable to my old B&D and the angle adjustment hold well and is easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Greg's review

customer_reviews.title: I've been fairly disappointed with this saw
customer_reviews.text: I've been fairly disappointed with this saw. My main complaint is that the base is not very solid or secure and is nearly impossible to get the blade to 90°. While cutting the base will twist leading cuts to travel. I've ruined a lot of cuts...at first I just assumed it was user error, but I've since realized it is just an extremely poorly designed base. I'll be looking to replace this as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse O'Chapo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Poorly built product. The lever that locks the blade depth into place broke off very first time changing the blade depth. Did not have enough power to go through the edge of a hollow core door. It could only get about 4-5 inches in, then would stall every time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Spalding

customer_reviews.title: Saw is not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: For more than 6 " would not cut straight line. After 15 months the motor would spark excessively, smoke and stop running. Became a useless tool
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid saw with some adjustment and accuracy limitations
customer_reviews.text: It cuts fine. Motor seems solid. Has a good heft and sits well in my hand. Where it comes up a bits short is in adjustment and accuracy. To set the zero point for the tilt you have to bend a metal prong with pliers. This is instead of a set screw you will find on a higher end saw. As for accuracy, the laser on mine is not aligned with the inscribed line on the base. If you aren't too picky and want a basic saw that cuts, get this. If you want a real quality saw, spend some additional money and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk do not buy! First time using this saw I was only trying to cut 1/4 plywood and it burned up the plastic diamond that holds the blade in place. I didn’t use it within the first 30 days to see it was junk so now I’m stuck with a junk say with no fix.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin,36,NY

customer_reviews.title: Badass Little Cutter
customer_reviews.text: This thing is killer, and I wasn't expecting much. The laser guide is super helpful when you need to make straight cuts. The safety system is easy enough to disengage during cuts, but enables right when you're done. It's convenient but stays out of your way. The blade that came with the saw is good, but you'll probably want to pick up a couple extra. I do wish the saw was a little bigger, but that has nothing to do with the product (you can buy bigger). All in all it was a great buy and I'd make it again.
customer_reviews.author: Briley Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Defective Right out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: First time I went to use it, the blade wouldn't turn. I checked the installation of the blade in the manual and it was put in correctly. I inspected the blade and the center had a diamond cut out shape rather than just a round hole as shown in the manual diagram and the blade just slides around. Whatever happened, it ended up digging into the plastic bearing in the center of the drill and is now rendered useless. Skil has always been a good reliable tool, but not this time.
customer_reviews.author: Desdemona

customer_reviews.title: Greater starter Circular Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is my first circular saw so I don't have much to compare it to, but I have found it works well and met my needs. I was reluctant to buy a corded tool, but for the limited home use I need it for it works great. It seems to have sufficient power and adjustability to meet my needs and I like that it came with a carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Parker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw, very powerful. Laser makes it very easy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw, many reviews say the laser was not bright enough, in this unit it isvery visible as you can see in the picture. One thing about with this great saw is you really need to change the cheap blade it comes with. I purchased Diablo Ultra Finish 60 teeth, had amazing results. Not to forget the saw is very powerful which will come in very handy tricky situations P.S: Buy an ear protection if you will be using frequently as this types of saws have brushless motors which is very loud. There is no way around it with the current technology for portable saws.
customer_reviews.author: Sinan OGUS

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile saw in the shop
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this saw for a few months now as I started woodworking as s hobby. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I replaced the saw blade with some diablo blades with more teeth for finer cuts. This thing cuts straight and true, and is very easy to use. It has a setting that I didn't even know about at first that allows for easy angle cuts. I recently replaced the base boards in my house and cut all my miter corners with this saw. No miter saw needed. No Jig needed. Just adjust the angle on the base and voila. Perfect 45 degree cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Skil Corded Saws: Tried and True
customer_reviews.text: After a string of cordless name-brand tool failures, I’ve been replacing my personal tool inventory with corded tools, and all but my Rigid miter saw are made by Skil. I now have a Skil jigsaw, Skil sawzawl, and Skil circular saw. This circular saw has an auto laser sight; and includes a blade and a tool bag for $35. It handles and operates smoothly, just like my other Skil saws. There’s no better corded saw for the price. I can’t speak for Skil outside of their corded saws; but if the task at hand requires a blade, I’ll be turning to Skil.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B

customer_reviews.title: Good but the laser would be easier to see if it was green
customer_reviews.text: Works great but the laser can not be seen in the sun and barely in the shade. Unless you use this in door the laser is not really usable. The zero or precision of the "deck" is different then the lasers zero. You have to either use the laser the entire time or just the deck measurements otherwise your cuts will be off by 1-3mm.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Lovely price, capability; requires some skills
customer_reviews.text: I think the product deserve a 5star but my skill doesn’t. Too ambitious to get this very powerful tool for a small job. Seriously the only downside (from my experience) is this thing requires some experience to handle lol. Anyway I got my job done with it (brought to to trim some wood pieces for my kid’s play set repair)
customer_reviews.author: mustard

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The main metal part around the saw blade was bent when this was delivered. I straightened it but it's almost impossible to cut a straight line with it AND I use a clamped straight edge guide. The laser line doesn't match where the saw cuts. Overall, there's nothing good about this saw that I can see. I had a Dewalt saw before this one. I was trying to save some money but I'll go back to a better brand because you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: extremely good saw, and for 60 its twice as good and half the price of others and love the laser
customer_reviews.text: laser is bright and works well, shoe is flat and solid i got perfect 90 degree cuts out of the box and it pushed through the wood like butter and was easy to get straight cuts even freehanded. with a speed square as a guide it gives perfect results every time. really solid contrustion with metal blade gaurd and housing. looks like it will last a long time. mine was 8.8 lbs and has a great design for the extra helping handle. you cant go wrong if you get a nice one
customer_reviews.author: LiliVale

customer_reviews.title: Good basic Circular Saw but with Faults
customer_reviews.text: This is a good basic saw with plenty of power for my limited iuse. The slip clutch on the blade was a bit tricky to set up but once it was adjusted I had no further problems in that regard. However, the laser is a different matter. It went out of alignment on the second use. Not a big issue for me as the laser feature was not a consideration for my purchase. If you want a saw with a reliable laser guide then steer away from this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Laser is extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: Normally I clamp a piece of wood or metal as a guide so I figured the laser would be superfluous. I find that for most of my non-critical work I can just mark the two ends, line up the blade with the first mark and the laser with the second mark and go from there. Even when using a guide, The laser helps tremendously for the initial positioning, so that the saw doesn't get started at an off-angle. I wish all my tools had a laser sight now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Works well for DIY small tasks around the house.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have unrealistic expectations considering the price and 'standard' quality of lower end power tools, but this saw seems to be worth the price. I did not find the shoe to be overly flimsy as remarked on in other reviews. I would not use it on a commercial building site, but for around the house tasks it is quite acceptable. It was new in the box and had no signs of being used. It came in a sealed, factory box, which was enclosed in another Amazon box. It arrived quickly and included the blade. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Wagon

customer_reviews.title: It's a Beaut, Clark
customer_reviews.text: This saw is pretty dang excellent. I have used it cutting both plywood and studs and so far I am very impressed. The "frickin' lazers" to help with cutting is a feature I, at first, scoffed at, but it is a nice feature.

customer_reviews.title: Fine for beginner but easy to grow out of
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. Maybe better than my fathers saw from the 80s, but easy to grow out of.. laser is off target, fence is square but not adjustable, so if needs adjustment you're out of luck. Fence not substantial enough to work well with a speed square. Other than that it's fine. Update - after about 6 months worth of diyer projects this thing sounds / feels like it's on its last leg.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Depth adjuster broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I am a handyman, have owned many circular saws including SKIL brand. This product is not worthy of the name and not even close to the quality of their mid to top end saws and worm drives. The depth adjust lever broke after 3 uses rendering the saw worthless! Before it broke... it cut great, was lightweight, and had an awesome carrying case. Just not a professional saw if you plan to use it more than a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Moen

customer_reviews.title: Very good for price !
customer_reviews.text: In the bang for buck dept its a 5 stAr. Very powerful and seems well made for the price. No better saw out there for fourty bucks ! Will update after more use but so far very impressed and im hard to please ! My everday saw is two hundred dollar makita.
customer_reviews.author: Brett r

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for DIYer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw for the average DIYer. Its relatively light and easy to handle, and seems to be accurate. I wasn't sure if I'd like the laser, but I found myself using it, when ripping long sheets of plywood. I suspect it wouldn't hold up with a contractor's workload, but it's perfect for weekend remodeling tasks.
customer_reviews.author: cookiefoot

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my 40 year old Skil saw!
customer_reviews.text: Well, my 40 year old Skil saw finally needed replacement after all these years. The cord was fraying and the motor started to make funny noises. I'm so glad I replaced it with another Skil saw. The new one is much more powerful than the old and has features like a safety lock, power indicator light , and laser beam that ensures I'm cutting on my line accurately. Considering the relatively inexpensive cost of this new saw, I'm almost glad the old one finally had to be scrapped.
customer_reviews.author: g.donofrio

customer_reviews.title: Skil Quality, Works Well, Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my previous Skil saw which still worked but was misplaced during a recent move. The fact that this was one of the least expensive options I researched is an added bonus. It's a pretty standard circular saw, but it is very well built and works well. The laser beam is nice to have, too. I first used this saw with a diamond blade to cut retaining wall blocks and it had no problem at all getting through. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: schmidtw

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Small, powerful. The laser is accurate. Bought one for my son, after buying this to replace my old Craftsman. Put a 64 tooth carbide blade on it and its a tiger. The zipper bag is ok, but not meant to be thrown around. I like the built in wrench holder too. My only note is that the high pitched whine it makes is different than other saws i have had in the past. You must wear ear protection - it's ear splitting. But you should be doing that anyway, right?
customer_reviews.author: D. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: It's got a friggin' laser!
customer_reviews.text: I know it's mentioned in the description, but I didn't realize it until I got it. There's a friggin'laser on its head! Once I got past the novelty of that, I realized how incredibly helpful that is to cutting. Even someone who's really bad at using a circular saw can use this thing and look much cooler. Also, it does help keep your cuts straight. Provided of course you have a guide line to follow. The saw also seems quite a bit lighter than others I've used. It's very ergonomic, and very easy to operate. All of this with the blade that comes in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D. Connors

customer_reviews.title: Blade would stop spinning
customer_reviews.text: This skill saw is pretty good when it works, but sometimes the blade would stop spinning and the motor would keep going mid-cut which was super, super frustrating. I tried to troubleshoot by myself but was fairly confused. The skill saw gives a specific tool to tighten on the blade, and states "do not overtighten blade" but then would stop spinning, shake, and would make burn marks on the blade and wood. When googled, it said the blade may not be tight enough, so I did overtighten and it seemed to work better. In the end, we ended up returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Sidra Malik

customer_reviews.title: Broke after using once.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I saw it for a good price and let it sit in the box while waiting for cooler weather to start project. Had trouble even getting it stared the 1st time but eventually got it going. Used it to cut one piece of wood flooring. Go to cut the next piece and the blade won’t spin. Kept adjusting the tightness and nothing worked. Figured out a piece on the saw broke off. Would not recommend this saw to anybody and since I bought before I started the project I am now out the money and have a broken saw.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast; a lot more power and more blade than my 5 1/2" saw. I used it to cut the tops off of 4x4 posts on my deck; went through those like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Minor inconveniences.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, fantastic for teens/adults getting into carpentry and wood working, easy to adjust depth and angle, cuts like a king. Next upgrade or for more advanced/daily folk would be the worm drive skil saws for sure. It's no worm drive, I wish blade was on left hand side. Only 2 hard stops on angle being 45° and 55° and Laser doesnt match 45° mark on saw. Sometimes hard to see where blade touches material without hunching over tool. Families old dewalt (I can supply prod #) easier to see blade, maybe a couple other differences but I prefer this tool for my workshop cuts
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Binar

customer_reviews.title: Cuts really well
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this saw a ton yet but it's great so far. My old skilsaw was a 12 amp, the 15 amp is much more powerful! Used the included blad and it cuts 2x4's like butter! The lasersight is a great touch and the markings on the sled are great, definitely would recommend it. I bought to replace my 20+ year old 12 amp skilsaw which has started dying.
customer_reviews.author: Huff Garage

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Was leaking oil when I took it out of the box, blade wouldn't attach or spin properly and would not cut plywood and started smoking. I tried replacing it with the same saw thinking it was a production error. The 2nd one cut ok but the height adjustment handle broke off the 2nd time I used it. Very lightweight but also very cheap and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Early..... yet but pleasantly surprised !  UPDATE  DISSAPOINTED !
customer_reviews.text: Putting it to the test ....came up short,,,.....poor workmanship........major vibration ........clumsy.......laser way off......surprised that this unit wear's the SKILL LABEL .......Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: NO GROUND PRONG on cord.
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough. I almost never use it, but it does work great. I could not believe there was no ground prong. On a tool that U use outdoors, sometimes on damp ground. What were they thinking? MY life is worth whatever a ground prong(and its wire)costs. I wish I had paid more, for something safer. (I bot this 2 or 3 years ago, maybe it has a ground prong now)
customer_reviews.author: spanky

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of cutting with rip fence. With any saw you buy, check the distance from saw blade to rip edge in front and back of saw blade. It should be parallel. It is normally not adjustable, so if not parallel it wont cut right. I checked several at the store and many were not parallel. This saw is parallel and cuts clean and straight.
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: This saw has skilz
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a little intimidated by power tools and circular saws in particular. Maybe it is a midlife crisis or the necessities of home ownership but I finally broke down and got this saw after trying to get by with a table saw and mitre saw for almost a year. This saw is fantastic. The laser line is extremely helpful to stay on track, the saw is light and easy to use. I appreciate the adjustable depth. The beats trying to cut flip and finish cut on the mitre saw. Would highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip B

customer_reviews.title: Latest version of the original Skil saw
customer_reviews.text: My 30 year old Skil saw finally quit after an especially difficult job and I went with what I know despite there being numerous other brands available. This new one is a bit lighter than the old but is just as capable and maybe a little easier to use. The laser guide actually does help in some situations. I figure I'll pass this one on to my kids and don't plan on needing another in my lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: clm

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful motor. Free traveling cast. Good warranty. In the past I have bought the disposable power tools at Harbor Freight. As cheap as they were , when they failed throw tool away get another. I priced 7 1/2 " saw at Harbor Freight . The saw only had a 11 amp. motor and priced at $ 69.00 . with only 90 day warranty. As much as prices at H/F have gone up it would pay a person to go on Amazon and check prices before heading out to H/F.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful product, very well packaged w/ a carry case and blade
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to put through an extended workload but it works well out of the box. comes with a canvas bag tote and a new blade. Very nice looking saw and cuts well without struggling (pine lumber). have not had a chance to cut any hardwood with it yet. So far, very impressed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rfcad

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new handheld circular saw to cut a door smaller, but didn’t want to spend too much money since I won’t use it too often. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and it appears to be durable. I would recommend to anyone, even if you plan on using it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: Love the laser light
customer_reviews.text: I had an old circular saw, couldn't cut with it anymore. I had worn it out. I have never had a SKIL anything before, but saw this one had a cord, a laser light and wasn't an arm and a leg in price, so decided to give it a try. I love it! That laser light helped so much, even with a pencil line I couldn't cut straight before, now I can. Wish I had found this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: K. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Skil Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a a replacement to a Skill I received as a Christmas gift back in 1984 (at that time that saw was $29.99) it served me very well but it finally died so a new Skil was what was needed. I hope to get the years of service from this unit as well.
customer_reviews.author: TFB2020

customer_reviews.title: good heavy duty item
customer_reviews.text: I used Rayobi for sometime and found that i used wrong tool for years... Rayobi is ok for plywood and causing issues for wood cutting... battery goes down...stuck etc... this tool is heavy and awesome... cut wood like plywood..
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is my first circular saw. It is light and the handle is ergonomic for me. The saw has a safety of a sort in that you need to push a button and pulled the trigger, which is good in my opinion. The laser works well, the depth setting process is easy, and I've had no negative issues after using for a couple weeks doing some light remodeling.
customer_reviews.author: Reinwald

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again in a heart beat
customer_reviews.text: Maybe not for full time carpenter but for above average handy homeowner like me would buy again in a heart beat. The laser guide is very handy and changing blades with blade lock button makes changing blade quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Pannone

customer_reviews.title: Good saw!
customer_reviews.text: Benefits: good clean cuts, laser light helps you stay on track and is able to cut quickly through most materials. The cord is long enough you can cut across plywood without it being in the way. Light weight and not bulky which allows easier movements.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Poor on all accounts
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this saw. It's a couple of degrees from square when it's upright, so you'll never get a true 90° cut. The safety mechanism makes it tricky to start with one hand, thus, to my mind, more unsafe (especially for inexperienced users). The saw itself will get you by for framing or light woodcraft. After three years of very heavy use on soft and hardwoods alike, my saw is bucking on me, and that's the only reason I need to trash it. I'm going with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: zach meyer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality- How's this getting 4 to 5 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Opened it up and immediately cut my finger on the stamped metal face plate that has sharp edges. The adjustment levers are thin metal and over -flex when trying to adjust angle and depth. The blade wrench is in an awful location that sticks out from the rear of the face plate and will catch on material when cutting. The real question is who and why is this tool being puffed up by power tool reviewers? It is a poor quality power tool- and should be represented as such. That said, I should have known better based on the price.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Blade not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The saw is great! I love that it has a bit of weight to it. Laser was slightly off but that was just something extra. Only complaint is the blade included is cheap and the one i received was defective. Tightened down and got about an inch into a test cut and it broke the center of the blade. Not sure what that’s about. Never seen anything like this before.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz Wyrabkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price. Plenty of power. Adjustments work easy and hold fast. Trigger leaves much to be desired. The trigger lockout on the hand grip is difficult to hold in with your thumb and pull the trigger at the same time. I ended up taping it down which defeats the purpose of it, but to me, I felt it makes the saw more dangerous to operate by having this safety feature so cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: YO YO Tangle

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice circ-saw for the diy'r. Not professional grade but nice none the less. I like the laser guide, the easy to access depth adjustment and came with a nice carry bag. Changing blades is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: "Danga! Danga!" -Steve Irwin
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a well-built saw for the price at first. Unboxed it, read the instructions, and installed the blade. Once I tried to use the saw, the blade wouldn't spin, and the saw started smoking... Unplugged it and started a return.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good value so far
customer_reviews.text: A new Skilsaw for less than the price of a new rotor for my 86' model. Plus lighter weight and more features! I only needed a light duty model as I rarely have occasion to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Daven

customer_reviews.title: Nice Saw
customer_reviews.text: For a hobby saw, this tool is very well made. Like the laser although it's hard to see outdoors. Probably shows up well in a shop situation. Saw comes with carbide tip general purpose blade and a soft sided carrying case. Good tool for someone who just needs one now and then. Might not hold up for professional work.
customer_reviews.author: JNthePen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw. The best saw I have ever used! I replaced 2 old saws I had, and this one is so much better! It is quieter than my old saws, and it cuts the wood like butter! This is the first saw I have had, with a laser. It is a great feature!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to control and gets job done
customer_reviews.text: Powerful enough to do many jobs. I replaced the stock blade with a 40 tooth diablo and the machine works like a charm. The guard doesn't always catch so you may have to manually lift the guard every once in a while depending on the thickness of the lumber. Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lee James

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: My circular saw had died and I need a cheap one that worked to complete a project. This saw came in reasonable time with Prime delivery and had both a manual and carry bag in the box with it. I had ordered a used one because it was cheaper and while the box was a bit scuffed, the product was still in the original plastic. It feels cheap to hold, but it works fine and gets the job done, which is honestly pretty impressive for <$50.
customer_reviews.author: fellsbane

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This was a major step up from my 20v B&D circ saw. Cuts are smooth, accurate, and powerful. It suits my homeowner tool needs and then some. Wish I'd bought one a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: A great saw! Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I used this saw on a rehab jobsite cutting out old, tough flooring & beams (and hit a nail or two), and this saw was up to whatever task I needed it to do. I'd put this up against any of the $139. saws sold at the big-box stores!
customer_reviews.author: Laswon -  Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We put it to the test on repairing an old deck and it's done a great job! If you don't mind switching from name brand tools then this is a really good choice for you. The money saved is an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Dodgerz23

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw! It's size and weight is its best ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw! It's size and weight is its best feature--perhaps 2/3 the size of the old style circular saws. Makes it easier and less tiresome to use. The laser guide lines up nicely with the saw line. I was able to cut more accurately with this saw than any previous circular saw I have used. As always, SKIL is nice quality for the price. I consider this saw a Best Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Show Me

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping and looks good
customer_reviews.text: So for I like it it is a lot lighter then others and the laser is bright the only drawback is the base it is a little flexible other then that it is worth the price you pay for I have not tried cutting with it yet I just went over the saw with a fine tooth comb
customer_reviews.author: shine

customer_reviews.title: Great price and laser precision
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great tool at an affordable price with laser guide. Purchased this tool to cut lumber for my deck repair and the use and easy of the laser beam made my cuts easier than ever and save me lots of time and lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: powerful beast with non-standard rip fence slot
customer_reviews.text: excellent upgrade from my 26 year old black and decker circular saw! the laser guide is excellent. my one gripe is that the common rip fence that fits other saws, B&D, ryobi, or Worx does not fit this saw. Skil has intentionally made the slots a wee bit smaller so the fence wont slide in. Had to enlarge the slots with a file.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Twin

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Unlocking mechanism on the blade not working out of the box. Hard to know if it will be a good saw, when you can’t install the blade!
customer_reviews.author: E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good dependable saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: We had a Skil saw for many years. It was used pretty hard as my wife has a wooden sign business. It finally died and so our first instinct was to get another one. This is a basic, yet appears to be as dependable and good as our last model. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: First power saw, bought for home use. Seems to work pretty good so far. Like others my laser beam is inaccurate and goes off to the left. This was pretty disappointing since I purposely bought this saw because of the laser feature. I figured it would help out the inexperienced user like myself. Do not expect the laser feature to work if you purchase this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon receipt - please contact me!
customer_reviews.text: We just opened this after a few months - it was a wedding gift for someone and the guide came bent. We have not used it yet and would like to exchange it for one that works if possible!
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Good power for the price
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a basic circular saw with good power. The price was good when compared to the higher end saws. I use it for a combination of chores including cutting framing lumber, furniture grade hardwoods and plywood, metal roofing and siding and it has handled whatever I've thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: dffswv

customer_reviews.title: Bolt fell out
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used this saw one of the bolts that holds the motor to the saw body just fell out. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Timazon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this saw, the company was no help.
customer_reviews.text: This saw didn't work, blade doesn't work when installed. Goes clockwise instead of counterclockwise on installation of blade.
customer_reviews.author: kennethwgallant

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels Good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Seems solid and easy to use. I like it's size and weight. It doesn't feel flimsy as others I've seen at the larger box stores for the same price. I'm pleased with the order. I also appreciate it comes complete with blade, and tools to quickly change the blade (or mount the blade)
customer_reviews.author: nft

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not great
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a decent saw. The main drawback is the crappy blade that comes with the saw. We replaced it with a Diablo blade and made much better performance after that.
customer_reviews.author: tylioromiosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Don't use power tools too often but did its job
customer_reviews.text: I don't need all too often but for the project I was working on it was definitely worth the price(especially since it was on sale). Easy to use with nice safety measures in place. The only took you need is stored on the saw in a way that it helps reduce injury from any kickbacks(only had 2 total at the end of the lifecycle for the blade, and they didn't cause any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cut for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: What a great saw. Bought it to replace a 20 year old Skil. It never would die, but it was tired and just didn't cut it. This saw with an upgraded blade cut the lumber to build my kids a bunk bed. Never bound, no splinters and the laser guide was spot on! Couldn't ask for anything else besides another 20 years worth of home projects!
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works well; wish I could give 4.5 stars. My biggest issue is that the bolt used to tighten and keep the blade in place comes loose often, but has an instruction not to over-tighten. Is the bolt is loose the blade doesn't spin, and having to stop mid-project to tighten is a bit inconvenient. Other than that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, but I did have a couple issue with the blade nut. You're not suppose to overtighten any circular saw blade to avoid kick back. However, I had to tighten this saw a bit more than usual. It got the job done once the blade was tightened enough to chew through the 3/4" red oak.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Good Lightweight saw.
customer_reviews.text: Just finished a deck project using this saw. It's light and easy to handle. Plenty of power. Easily adjustable. The laser guide is a nice feature but honestly didn't use it much because I was working in sunlight most of the time which makes the laser hard to see. For the occasional DIY person I would recommend this. If I used one professionally I'd upgrade to something with a break.
customer_reviews.author: steve r

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our home project
customer_reviews.text: We bought these because we're building a built-in entertainment center in our living room. We've use it A LOT and it hasn't disappoint us. It's really easy to use, we have no experience, first time using one and doing something like this. Just read the manual real quick and got the hang of it in no time. Recomend it 100%
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: You can never have too many saws
customer_reviews.text: Very nice basic circular saw. I own a table saw, a track saw, and a chop saw but this one has it’s place and is reasonably priced. It even came with a nylon carry bag for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Roman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Circular Saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a TANK! I bought it for a live edge slab table I'm making, and I needed something with more power than my old circular saw. This cut through 2 1/2 inch maple like no problem! Also, the 'power on' light is very handy. Great saw at a great price, and I couldn't recommend it more!
customer_reviews.author: Drew K

customer_reviews.title: home owner saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought a skill table saw im very happy with so I thought I would give a circular saw a try for the first time in 40 years, it has plenty of power, but if you use it every day, spend the extra money and get one with better quality. don't like the steel base, depth control keeps coming loose and falling when your trying to make a cut, lazer is not accurate, a lot of vibration!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've got SKIL
customer_reviews.text: Super affordable circular saw that gets the job done. I just finished framing an addition and leaned on this saw to get the job done. The laser provides the ability to "rip" lumber with higher accuracy (straighter cuts). Also, impressed by the ability to make angled cuts (22.5 or 45 degree). I would recommend this saw to anyone who hasn't developed a particular loyalty to power tool brand.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to get an underpowered circular saw nor did I want to break the bank. This one worked out great for me and I am satisfied with my purchase. I am using it to help frame my basement and build some garage shelving. The laser light for cutting is a nice feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased with merchandise
customer_reviews.text: This product was returned twice (the initial and the replacement order) as neither saw worked. We requested a refund. That was 30 days ago. We have not received a refund as of today, 4/23/2020. Would appreciate knowing what is the hold up. Judith Gamble
customer_reviews.author: Judith

product_meta.title: SKIL 5280-01 15-Amp 7-1/4-Inch Circular Saw with Single Beam Laser Guide
product_meta.description: For the more experienced user who needs a powerful circular saw with advanced features, the SKIL 5280 7-1/4 inch circular saw is the saw for the job. The 15-Amp motor has the power and performance you need to quickly cut lumber and sheet goods for a room addition, deck and more. The single-beam laser guides cuts with increased accuracy, while the integrated dust blower keeps the line of cut sawdust free. The 51 degree bevel, with positive stop at 45 degrees, gives a variety of cut options, while blades changes are easier with spindle lock and on-tool wrench.
feature_bullets: Powerful 15-amp motor delivers 5,300-RPM for greater speed and faster cuts
7-1/4-in carbide-tipped blade included. Spindle lock for easy blade changes.
51 degree bevel capacity for a wide variety of cuts. Arbor size: 5/8 inches, cord length: 6 feet
Dust blower keeps line-of-cut free of sawdust for improved visibility.Anti-snag lower guard reduces snags when making narrow cut-offs

specifications.Included Components: Circular Saw, 24-Tooth Carbide Blade, Wrench, Carry Bag
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,184 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
